wikipedia_page.main: David Henry Kilner Smith (29 June 1940 – 17th December 2021) was an English cricketer who played first-class cricket for Derbyshire between 1965 and 1970 and for Orange Free State between 1976 and 1978.

Gibbs was a right-handed opening batsman, "a fluent, well-organised player",Wisden 1969, p. 348. who mostly partnered David Smith or Ian Hall during his time with Derbyshire. He was also an occasional right-arm off-break bowler.
His father David Smith played over 100 times, mainly for Derbyshire, between the mid-1960s and the early 1970s.

| 1968 || 30 || 6 || 6 || 18 || 8 || || || || || ||R2 || || Derek Morgan||David Smith ||Harold Rhodes || Bob Taylor

Philip Russell and David Smith were both promoted from the second XI for games at the end of the season. Russell played steadily for the club for many years. Smith became a high scorer for the club over four later seasons.

Derbyshire played 28 games in the County Championship, one match against the touring Indians and one match against Cambridge University.  They won six first class matches, lost six matches and drew eighteen matches. They lost their only match in the Gillette Cup. Derek Morgan was  captain. David Smith scored most runs. Harold Rhodes took most wickets for the club.
*David Smith, 81, English cricketer (Derbyshire, Orange Free State).David Smith passes away
